CatDescriptText: Mr. Eugene Lyles, J&L worker, 505 Elizabeth Street, Aliquippa, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 29, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that taverns should be permitted to remain open past midnight on Saturdays?" answer reads: "For my sake, they can close them all now. I don't have much use for strong alcoholic drinks."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Eugene Lyles, wearing flecked button down coat with collar and lapels, light colored v-neck sweater, dark striped button down collared shirt, and dark hat, carrying package, standing in front of Fanny Farmer Candies, Dimlings candy store in background, Wood Street, Downtown
